dataStructure.name: sid.org.tmforum.tip.cbe.root.ManagementDomain
dataStructure.description:
A ManagementDomain class represents a special grouping of ManagedEntities that has two important properties. First, it is used to partition managed objects into a meaningful logical grouping. One important use of such a grouping is to provide a means to define which EMS (as well as which NMS) manages, monitors, etc. which set of devices. It also provides a means to show how management functions are distributed and scaled. Second, it defines a common administrative domain that is used to administer the managed objects that it contains. This implies that all of the managed objects contained in this ManagementDomain are administered similarly - either by the same user, group of users or policy.

This entity is abstract

This entity is optional
dataStructure.label: ManagementDomain

child.name: managementDomain
